title: Asset watcher fails to update assets when path contains "../"

body:
## Bevy version
Version 0.15.2

## What you did

My bevy app is a folder in a workspace, and the asset folder is in the workspace root. I initialize the `AssetPlugin` like this:
```rust
app.add_plugins(AssetPlugin {
    file_path: "../assets".to_string(),
    ..default()
});
```

Then while the app is running, I altered an image in the asset directory.
## What went wrong

Whenever an asset updates, a panic occurs: (edited)
```
thread 'notify-rs debouncer loop' panicked at <home-folder>/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/bevy_asset-0.15.2/src/io/file/file_watcher.rs:51:9:
FileWatcher::get_asset_path() failed to strip prefix from absolute path: absolute_path="<path-to-workspace>/my-app/../assets/gui/buttons.png", root="<path-to-workspace>/assets"
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```
In a project with a different folder layout, the asset updates instead.

## Additional information

I cloned bevy and changed the `FileEventHandler::get_path` function to this:
```
    fn get_path(&self, absolute_path: &Path) -> Option<(PathBuf, bool)> {
        let absolute_path = absolute_path.canonicalize().unwrap();
        Some(get_asset_path(&self.root, &absolute_path))
    }
```
This is on line 264 of `bevy_assets/src/io/file/file_watcher.rs`. This fixed the issue

I also tested several of bevy's examples with the file_watcher feature and it worked as expected in all cases, so I believe this change is a complete solution to the issue.
